-- Anachronox \ Pacifix --

Anachronox nods, his face void of emotion, "If you say so 
Belthassan. If you wish her to live she will." He follows Belthassan 
into the control room feeling confident. 

He takes in the techno-organic mesh of screens and circuitry mixed 
with living material in wonder. He is ripped out of his trance like 
moment by Daemos commanding voice. "Yes Commander Daemos. I am 
Anachronox." He approaches Daemos.

-----------------------------

Pacifix reaches the water, and his wheels fold under his vehicle 
torso. They inflate slightly and he begins to move ahead at and 
average, if not slow, pace.

Eventually, he reaches then now techno-organic Austraila, and his 
vehicle reverts to it's normal operating mode. He continues on to 
the Shadow Destiny.

ooC: My apologies for the delay in posting.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Belthassan bursts in laughter.
> 
> Belthassan: Haha! Sorry! Do not take it personnal from her! She is 
> always like that, even with me or Daemos! Agreed, she is rather 
> overconfident of herself, but once she fights you, she will 
> acknowledge you as a worthy warrior. But, when that combat does 
> happen, please, leave her alive. At least for me.
> 
> He climbs some stairs and arrives in the control room.
> 
> Belthassan: This is the control room. Daemos should...
> 
> A voice arises from just in front of the main screen. 
> 
> Daemos: Yes, I am here, Belthassan.
> 
> Daemos is standing in front of the main screen. He continues 
without 
> looking back to the two others.
> 
> Daemos: Anachronox, is it? Please, come closer.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > -- Anachronox / Pacifix / Crossroads --
> > 
> > Anachronox nods and continues to follow Belthassan.
> > 
> > "Her obvious dislike of me may get her killed sometime..." He 
grunts 
> > as they walk, "Hmmm..."
> > 
> > ---------------------
> > 
> > Pacifix nods in approval, his sorrow noticable even though he 
> doesn't 
> > allow it to affect his job. "We appreciate your support Gesper. 
I 
> > have a bad feeling about Firedrill/Anachronox; I don't think 
that 
> > we'll be able to get Firedrill back..."
> > 
> > He heads to the exit, "I'm heading over to your base now," he 
> > inclines his head in Gesper's direction, "Crossroads, I'll need 
you 
> > to watch the base till I get back. Just hover around the control 
> room 
> > and monitor the perimeter defenses. They should warn you of 
anything 
> > out of order."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Belthassan: Yes. I guess our commander is eager to see you. 
Come 
> > with 
> > > me. He is in the control room.
> > > 
> > > He starts walking. He turns his head to the rookie and says:
> > > 
> > > Belthassan: Curious one, is she not?
> > > 
> > > ------------------------
> > > 
> > > Gesper seemed astonished by the news.
> > > 
> > > Gesper: Ah... well... I... wanted to know if you had had any 
news 
> > from 
> > > the Tripredacus, but I guess you just gave me those news... 
I'm 
> > sorry 
> > > about what happened. Even if Firedrill cannot be brought back 
> > though, 
> > > you can be assured that we will stand aside the Autobots.
